news.title: Rajasthan auctions 12 new sand mining plots despite HC order on replenishment studies
news.para: Rajasthan's mining department is moving ahead with auctions for new sand mining plots. This comes after the Rajasthan High Court cancelled previous gravel mining leases. The court had questioned the state's approach to natural replenishment of mined resources. Experts and industry representatives claim these new auctions disregard established norms and Supreme Court guidelines.

news.title: Vedaanta Senior Living invests ₹50 crore to develop senior living project in Tamil Nadu
news.para: Vedaanta Senior Living, in partnership with the Sameera Group, is developing Vedaanta Ananta in Chengalpattu, Tamil Nadu. The ₹50 crore investment will deliver 69 villas starting from ₹50 lakh, crafted to help seniors live independently with dignity.

news.title: SWAMIH Fund sanctions ₹115 crore for completion of Antriksh Valley project in Greater Noida West
news.para: The SWAMIH Investment Fund I has approved up to ₹115 crore for the stalled Antriksh Valley project in Greater Noida West. This funding will facilitate project completion, including a redesigned residential tower, after the new management cleared land dues and resolved homebuyer claims. The investment aims to restore homebuyer confidence in stalled housing projects.

news.title: Navi Mumbai civic body collects ₹650 crore in property tax, 62% pay digitally
news.para: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation has collected Rs 650 crore in property tax this fiscal year, with 62% of payments made digitally. The civic body is intensifying efforts to meet its Rs 1,000 crore target by March 31, issuing notices and attaching properties of defaulters.

news.title: Finally, Chandigarh housing board allottees can make need-based changes
news.para: Chandigarh Housing Board allottees are set to benefit from approved need-based changes. UT administrator Gulab Chand Kataria sanctioned relaxations on construction norms. These changes cover lifts, internal modifications, courtyards, and water tank capacity. Over 4.5 lakh residents in CHB-allotted houses are expected to gain from these policy updates. The decision aims for clarity and adherence to planning.

news.title: Chandigarh civic body to rework C&D plant tender after zero bidder response
news.para: Chandigarh Municipal Corporation is revising its tender for the construction and demolition waste plant. Bidders have not shown interest in three previous attempts. The plant was offered as a revenue-generating project. Officials are now re-examining financial viability to attract participation. The civic body aims to make the tender more appealing for operators.

news.title: IIFL Home Finance secures $300 million loan from Asian Development Bank
news.para: IIFL Home Finance secured a significant $300 million external borrowing facility, with $150 million from the Asian Development Bank and another $150 million from partner banks. This funding will primarily support home loans for women in low-income areas, with a portion dedicated to green-certified affordable housing. The initiative aims to address India's housing deficit, particularly for vulnerable groups.

news.title: Mangaluru civic body launches drive to boost property tax collection
news.para: Mangaluru City Corporation has launched a campaign to boost property tax collection, including a 3% annual hike based on market value. Property owners can pay online or at Karnataka One centers, with the corporation urging timely payments to fund city development. A drive will commence to collect pending dues from property owners to avoid legal action.

news.title: Rising land prices push Visakhapatnam towards vertical housing
news.para: Visakhapatnam's residential market is witnessing a surge in vertical housing, with developers opting for 40-50 storey complexes due to rising land prices and dwindling plot availability. This shift offers buyers lower per-square-foot costs and enhanced amenities, while improving land-use efficiency and project viability.

news.title: Merlin Group acquires 3.3-acre land near Pune’s Koregaon Park for ₹273 crore
news.para: Merlin Prime Spaces, a subsidiary of the Kolkata property developer, is looking to build a commercial project on the land parcel with a total investment of over Rs 1,000 crore including the land cost.

news.title: HC says revised slabs in keeping with law, upholds Ghaziabad civic body's property tax hike
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has upheld the Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation's (GMC) decision to hike property taxes, dismissing a petition by former councillors. The court found the method of fixing minimum monthly rent rates and revising taxes legally sound, despite residents facing a three to fourfold increase in their bills.

news.title: AI flags 42,000 ineligible PMAY applicants in Prayagraj
news.para: Artificial Intelligence has significantly boosted the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana in Prayagraj, uncovering approximately 42,000 ineligible applicants. A new mobile app system, requiring photo uploads of existing homes, helped AI identify those falsely claiming homelessness. This technological intervention is ensuring aid reaches genuine beneficiaries in need of housing.

news.title: Telangana RERA order Green Space Bagiratha's builder to pay fine of ₹3,000 per day
news.para: The Telangana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (TGRERA) has imposed a daily penalty of Rs 3,000 on a realty developer for failing to comply with its earlier order. The developer was directed to pay the penalty for non-completion of the 'Green Space Bagiratha' project and non-adherence to statutory norms.

news.title: Odisha housing minister reveals ORERA case backlog
news.para: Odisha Real Estate Regulatory Authority (ORERA) has registered 4,334 cases against 714 builders since 2017, with 1,028 still pending. Procedural and legal bottlenecks, including lack of cooperation and delay tactics by lawyers, are hindering resolution. The government is implementing measures like increased staffing and public awareness campaigns to expedite justice for homebuyers.

news.title: FIR filed against six directors of two real estate firms for ₹5 crore fraud in Gurugram
news.para: An FIR has been filed against six directors of Ameya Commercial Projects and Anek Estates and Ventures. A Gurugram resident alleged she was cheated of Rs 5 crore in a commercial project. The complainant claims she was promised timely possession and a sale deed. The OC was issued, but possession and sale deed were not executed.

news.title: Mortgage rates in USA dip below 6%, but supply remains key
news.para: U.S. mortgage rates have slipped under six percent for the first time in three and a half years, but economists view the drop as short‑lived. They do not expect it to meaningfully boost buyer demand, noting that the real bottleneck is the limited number of homes on the market.

news.title: WeWork India to add 7,700 desks across Hyderabad, Pune and Bengaluru; to invest ₹110 crore
news.para: WeWork India is expanding its presence in Hyderabad, Pune, and Bengaluru. The company will add approximately 7,700 desks across these cities. New centers in Hyderabad and Pune are expected to open by July and August 2026 respectively. Bengaluru's expansion is targeted for completion by September 2026.

news.title: Path to Viksit Bharat runs through strong, sustainable cities: Housing minister
news.para: As India approaches 2047, its future will be decided in its cities. The urban population is set to reach 80 crore, driving a major portion of national economic output. To harness this potential, the government is prioritizing stronger urban infrastructure, reliable public services, and better quality of life.

news.title: CAG flags irregularities in PMAY-Gramin implementation in Bihar
news.para: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has highlighted serious irregularities in the implementation of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana-Gramin in Bihar. Audit findings revealed that houses were allotted to ineligible children and that some approved houses were geo-tagged at faraway locations, including outside the state’s borders.

news.title: Recovery of MahaRERA dues to be intensified, Maharashtra minister informs assembly
news.para: The Maharashtra government is set to intensify its drive to recover long-pending dues under MahaRERA. State minister Shambhuraj Desai told the assembly that the current recovery rate of 34 percent must be significantly improved. District collectors have been directed to fast-track these cases, including identifying and attaching properties of defaulting builders.
